thread.title: Kin of man beaten to death by shadow-boxing nut pray for justice
thread.title_full: Kin of man beaten to death by shadow-boxing nut pray for justice

author: Bryon Smith, Leonard Greene
title: Kin of man beaten to death by shadow-boxing nut pray for justice
text:
Mourners at Bronx mosque on Sunday after service honoring Gambian immigrant Bakary Darboe, allegedly killed by Junal Jordan. (Luiz C. Ribeiro/For New York Daily News ) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  40 PM 
Friends and family of a West African man beaten to death in the elevator of the Bronx building where he lived vowed to be in court every day to make sure the victim goes back to jail, and stays there this time. 
“Police are not supposed to release people that have felony records into the community who will commit crimes and kill people,” said Abukarr Jarju, a friend of Bakary Darboe, 46. The immigrant from Gambia was beaten to death Friday by a deranged ex-con as he stepped onto the elevator of his Melrose building last week. 
Cops arrested career criminal Junal Jordan and charged him with murder after the Thursday evening attack. Officials said the parolee had been shadow-boxing in the hallway, and attacked Darboe for no reason when the elevator doors opened. 
Darboe begged him, “Get off me,” according to police. 
Lunatic beats Bronx neighbor to death in unprovoked attack Front page of the New York Daily News for February 4, 2017: NYU lab technician Bakary Darboe, 46, forgot his wallet in his apartment - and paid for it with his life when ex-con neighbor Junal Jordan yanked him from an elevator and beat him to death with a cell phone. (New York Daily News) 
Jordan, 40, who has been arrested nearly 20 times and did two stints in prison, is accused of beating him to death with a cell phone. The two men did not know each other, officials said. 
At a memorial service Sunday, where Darboe was lauded as a devout Muslim and a devoted family man, mourners vowed to keep pressure on prosecutors to make sure that justice is served. 
“If we don’t stand up, we don’t know who’s going to be next,” said Imam Mohamad Sillah. “We want everybody to show, your sister, your wife, your kid. Take everybody to show that this guy has somebody behind him.” 
Sillah was talking to friends and family at Masjid Omar on Grand Concourse, a mosque where more than 100 mourners joined in prayers. Bakary Darboe, 46, was beaten to death Friday by a deranged ex-con as he stepped onto the elevator of his Melrose building last week. (Obtained by Daily News) 
Darboe’s wife and oldest brother were scheduled to travel back to Gambia with the victim’s body. 
The men in Darboe’s family took part in the ceremonial washing of his body at the George H. Weldon Funeral Home Saturday. 
“Everybody is holding up good,” said the brother, Manding, 56. “We appreciate everything from the rest of the community and the people who have come.” 
Darboe, an NYU lab technician, was on his way to night classes at Mercy College. He crossed paths with the killer after going back to his apartment to get his wallet.
